com.magnet.context.api

Interface Context

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Context
extends Serializable
    Context is a composite object containing all data that is meaningful to operational constructs within the platform.

    In general, threadlocals should be avoided and instead Context instances should be used. This is because of threading pool hygiene as well as RPC calls to external processes. Only Serializable data will be transported to remote services.

    Entry points into the platform (e.g., the restful / web container) will be responsible for setting up the active call context.

    The session and the conversational state elements are intentionally opaque, requiring the caller to have a key/identity object to gain access. It is recommended that the keys are using something other than strings when strict security needs to be enforced. 

          // secure solution
      Object key = new Object();
      context.setAttribute(type, key, value); 
      
      // non-secure solution
      String key = "key";
      context.setAttribute(type, key, value);

      Attribute types

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Every Context instance has a global UUID.

      • close

        void close()
        Contexts are closeable in the case where nested code wants to terminate the Session prematurely (e.g., logout). In such a case, Session data, User, and the set of authenticated UserAccounts are cleared.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true if the context was closed, and no data current exists in one of the Type maps.

      • hasAttribute

        boolean hasAttribute(Context.Type type,
                   String key)
        Check whether context contains an attribute
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key
        Returns:
        true if the attribute is contained, even if it's null.

      • setAttribute

        void setAttribute(Context.Type type,
                String key,
                Object value)
        Sets an attribute, overwriting whatever value(s) were previously present
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key

      • addAttribute

        void addAttribute(Context.Type type,
                String key,
                Object value)
        Sets an attribute if the first, otherwise converting attribute to a collection and adding it as one of the values.
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key
        value - attribute value

      • addAllAttributes

        void addAllAttributes(Context.Type session,
                    Map<Object,Object> recoveredMap)
        Provides a bulk add operation provided a map of attributes.
        Parameters:
        session - attribute type
        recoveredMap - attributes as map of key-value pairs

      • getFirstAttribute

        <T> T getFirstAttribute(Context.Type type,
                      String key)
        Retrieves the single attribute. If multiple attributes exist this will return the first attribute that was originally added.
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key
        Returns:
        first matching attribute of that type, or null if none match

      • getAttributes

        <T> Collection<T> getAttributes(Context.Type type,
                              String key)
        Retrieves all attributes for the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - attributes class type
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key
        Returns:
        collection of matching attributes

      • removeAttribute

        void removeAttribute(Context.Type type,
                   String key)
        Clears out the attribute(s) for the key and type.
        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        key - attribute key

      • getMap

        Map<String,Object> getMap(Context.Type type)
        Returns a copy of the map as it is reflective at the time of the call.

        There is typically no consistency guarantees, therefore.

        Parameters:
        type - attribute type
        Returns:
        attributes as map of key-value pairs

      • getUserUri

        com.magnet.api.MagnetUri getUserUri()
        Returns:
        the MagnetUri representing the User this context applies to (i.e., the owner id).

      • getUserSubject

        Subject getUserSubject()
        Returns:
        the User subject this context applies to.

      • setIdentity

        void setIdentity(com.magnet.api.MagnetUri uri,
               Subject subject)
        Sets the user identity iff there is currently no user authenticated on the stack.
        Parameters:
        uri - MagnetUri uniquely identifying user
        subject - user identity
